info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 1:02PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MCDOWELL... SOUTHEASTERN MITCHELL AND SOUTHEASTERN YANCEY COUNTIES UNTIL 130 PM EDT... At 101 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Spruce Pine to 13 miles west of Marion. These storms were nearly stationary. Locations to be impacted include... Spruce Pine, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, Little Switzerland, Woodlawn and Busick. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
